headline: Does Linde’s 7% Dividend Hike And Backlog Strengthen The Bull Case For LIN?
summary: On February 24, 2026, Linde plc announced that its Board approved a 7% increase in the quarterly dividend to US$1.60 per share, payable on March 26, 2026 to shareholders of record on March 11, 2026, marking the company’s 33rd consecutive year of quarterly dividend growth. This extended dividend growth streak, supported by a record US$10.00 billion project backlog and positive analyst commentary, underlines how Linde’s cash generation and long-term contracts are supporting ongoing returns to...

headline: CSX CEO: Flat industrial results holding back railroad freight growth
summary: CSX Chief Executive Steve Angel says it should be no surprise that railroads are struggling to grow their freight volumes. “When you look around the world, there really isn’t much growth,” Angel told an investor conference in his first detailed public remarks outside of earnings calls since becoming CEO in September. China is no longer […] The post CSX CEO: Flat industrial results holding back railroad freight growth appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Linde Increases Dividend 7%
summary: WOKING, England, February 24, 2026--Linde plc (Nasdaq: LIN) today announced its Board of Directors has declared a 7% increase in the company's quarterly dividend to $1.60 per share. This marks the 33rd consecutive year of quarterly dividend increases on the company’s common stock.
